paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on BRCA2 variants, including penetrance data and functional studies.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: CRISPR-SelectTIME revealed a ~5-fold loss of cells with the BRCA2-T2722R variant over time.

functional_data.summary: The BRCA2-T2722R variant was shown to have a loss-of-function effect, leading to a significant reduction in cell survival over time.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is associated with loss of function in the context of breast cancer.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence for pathogenicity based on functional assays.
variants.additional_notes: The study indicates that the BRCA2-T2722R variant is a known pathogenic variant.
key_quotes: CRISPR-SelectTIME revealed a ~5-fold loss of cells with the BRCA2-T2722R variant over time.
This suggests that most cells with variant knock-in on one allele had obtained an inactivating editing outcome on the other allele.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for the BRCA2 variant was extracted from the main text.
